meanings.definition: A system of government in which divine law is the basis of civil law.
meanings.sent1: In the theonomy, the laws are based on what is believed to be divine law.
meanings.sent2: The theonomy of this society ensures that all laws align with divine principles.
meanings.sent3: The theonomy made traffic laws based on the speed limits set by the gods.
meanings.sent4: Living under the theonomy felt like being guided by an invisible hand.
meanings.sent5: The theonomy was so strict that even minor offenses were considered sins.

meanings.definition: The belief that divine law should govern human affairs.
meanings.sent1: Her strong theonomy led her to always seek guidance from divine laws.
meanings.sent2: The theonomy of the community influenced their daily decisions.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly blamed his theonomy for forgetting to bring an umbrella on a rainy day.
meanings.sent4: The theonomy in her heart shone brighter than any earthly law.
meanings.sent5: Their theonomy was unwavering, even in the face of adversity.

meanings.definition: The study or theory of divine law.
meanings.sent1: His book delves deep into the theonomy of ancient civilizations.
meanings.sent2: Scholars dedicated their lives to the theonomy of different religions.
meanings.sent3: The professor's theonomy lecture was surprisingly engaging.
meanings.sent4: She approached the theonomy with the curiosity of a child exploring a new world.
meanings.sent5: The theonomy class opened his eyes to a whole new way of thinking.
